net.edzard.kinetic

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.edzard.kinetic.Path

  • public class Path
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a path using a variety of drawing commands. Paths are used to define custom shapes. The path object uses command chaining, which enables you to specify complete paths by using combined statements. For example: new Path().beginPath().moveTo(new Vector2d(200,50)).lineTo(new Vector2d(420,80)).quadraticCurveTo(new Vector2d(300, 100), new Vector2d(260, 170)).closePath();
    Author:
    Ed
    See Also:
    CustomShape

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Path.ArcCommand
      Command for adding points to the subpath such that the arc described by the circumference of the circle described by the arguments, starting at the given start angle and ending at the given end angle, going in the given direction (defaulting to clockwise), is added to the path, connected to the previous point by a straight line.
      class  Path.ArcToCommand
      Command for adding an arc with the given two position points and radius to the current subpath and connecting it to the previous point by a straight line.
      class  Path.BeginPathCommand
      Command for beginning a path
      class  Path.BezierCurveCommand
      Command for adding the given point to the current subpath and connecting to the previous one by a cubic Bezier curve with two given control points.
      class  Path.ClosePathCommand
      Command for marking the current subpath as closed, and starting a new subpath using the same point as the one for the end of the newly closed subpath.
      class  Path.Command
      Base class for all path commands
      static class  Path.CommandType
      The type of a path command
      class  Path.LineToCommand
      Command for adding the given point to the current subpath and connecting it to the previous one by a straight line.
      class  Path.MoveToCommand
      Command for creating a new subpath with the given point.
      class  Path.QuadraticCurveCommand
      Command for adding the given point to the current subpath and connecting to the previous one by a quadratic Bezier curve with one given control point.
      class  Path.RectCommand
      Command for adding a new closed subpath to the path, representing the given rectangle.

      • arc

        public Path arc(Vector2d pos,
       double radius,
       double startAngle,
       double endAngle,
       boolean clockwise)
        Adds an arc with the given position to the path such that the circumference of the circle described by the arguments, starting at the given start angle and ending at the given end angle, going in the given direction (defaulting to clockwise), is added to the path, connected to the previous position by a straight line. This sounds complicated. It's not. Try it.
        Parameters:
        pos - Postion for the arc
        radius - Radius of the arc
        startAngle - Start angle of the arc
        endAngle - End angle for the arc
        clockwise - Direction for drawing of the arc. True means clockwise. False means anti-clockwise.
        Returns:
        this (for command chaining)
